summary: This is a February 2, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, providing an index of newly produced discovery materials. The production includes the final Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) report regarding the 2006-2008 criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, as well as corrected reproductions of previously produced materials.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced the final Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) report regarding the 2006-2008 criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.
The discovery production included corrected versions of previously produced materials that had incorrect Bates numbers, as well as new items like an AT&T subpoena return and FBI logs.
The letter confirms the government's ongoing discovery obligations in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
All produced materials are governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, with many items designated as 'confidential.'
The production index references FBI-collected item logs regarding 10 yearbooks collected from West Palm Beach.
